title: Virgin Orbit lays off most employees
summary: Virgin Orbit announced late March 30 it was laying off the vast majority of its employees after failing to raise additional funding, putting the launch company’s future in jeopardy.

title: BREAKING! Virgin Orbit To Cease Operations, Lay Off 90% After Funding Failure
summary: Virgin Orbit has informed its employees that the company will be ceasing operations "for the foreseeable future".

title: Virgin Orbit fails to secure funding, will cease operations and lay off nearly entire workforce
summary: Virgin Orbit is ceasing operations “for the foreseeable future” after failing to secure a funding lifeline, CEO Dan Hart told employees during an all-hands meeting on Thursday afternoon, and will layoff nearly all of its workforce.

title: Maxar eyes military customers for satellite images of objects in space
summary: Maxar, an Earth imaging company, is looking to build a new business imaging objects in space.

title: Telesat still bullish on Lightspeed despite funding uncertainty
summary: Telesat remains committed to developing its Lightspeed low Earth orbit broadband constellation despite ongoing delays to cover the project’s rising costs, CEO Dan Goldberg said March 29.

title: New Program Office Leads NASA’s Path Forward for Moon, Mars
summary: NASA has established the new Moon to Mars Program Office at NASA Headquarters in Washington to carry out the agency’s human exploration activities at the Moon and Mars for the benefit of humanity. Amit Kshatriya will serve as the agency’s first head of the office, effective immediately.

title: NASA Announces Moon To Mars Program Office
summary: NASA has announced the establishment of the Moon to Mars Program Office at NASA Headquarters in Washington DC.

title: BREAKING! Astronomers Discover Two Closest Black Holes to Earth
summary: Astronomers have made an exciting discovery using data from the European Space Agency’s Gaia mission. They have found not one, but two black holes that are the closest to Earth ever discovered.

title: Investing in Space: Boeing’s got to get going
summary: “Boeing pushed back the flight schedule of its Starliner capsule by several months, the company said on a conference call with reporters Wednesday.”

title: Chinese defense contractor to begin launching VLEO satellites
summary: A major Chinese state-owned defense contractor is preparing to launch the first satellite for a very low Earth orbit constellation.
